page.title: 07Plant life around Gwynfryn
page.content: Gwynfryn is botanically interesting because it has large areas of undisturbed pasture.The soil is thin and poor with large rocks scattered about.For this reason there is not much farming and no fertiliser is used on the land. Many wild plants can be found here. They include plants that are mostly rare in other parts of the country.In spring there are thousands of cowslips and during the year we can see some of the less common plants like Salad Burnet,Kidney Vetch,Goat's Beard,Wall Rue and six different species of orchid.All these can be found within one mile of the village. The isolated position of the area means that not many visitors come to the area to pick and trample on flowers.
